bestBHT.bht: Jesus teaches that true greatness is achieved through selfless service to others. He says, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all. By willingly taking the lowest position and serving others with humility and cheerfulness, one can find true greatness in the eyes of God. This principle of humility and selflessness is emphasized by Jesus in various instances, highlighting the importance of putting others before ourselves and embracing the role of a servant.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all.
Philip Schaff: If the desire is selfish, the plan will fail, he shall be last of all.
If he would be truly first then he will take this lower position voluntarily.
Archibald T. Robertson: Jesus gives them the rule of greatness: 'If any man would be first (πρωτος) he shall be last (εσχατος) of all, and minister (διακονος) of all.'
This saying of Christ, like many others, he repeated at other times (Mark 10:43; Matthew 23:8; Luke 22:24).
Then Jesus taking him in his arms (εναγκαλισαμενος, aorist middle participle, late Greek word from αγκαλη as in Luke 2:28) spoke again to the disciples.
John Gill: Instead of being first, he shall be last; and instead of having superior reverence and respect, he shall be debased, and treated with neglect and contempt.
The only way to preferment in Christ's kingdom, or in the Gospel dispensation, is humility and meekness, and performing the lowest services to all, with diligence and cheerfulness.
John Wesley: Let him be the least of all — Let him abase himself the most.

bhtAttempts.bht: If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all. Jesus gives them the rule of greatness, that if anyone wants to be first, they must be willing to take the lowest position and serve others. This saying of Christ, which he repeated at other times, emphasizes the importance of humility and selflessness. Instead of seeking personal glory or respect, one should willingly humble themselves and perform the lowest services to others with diligence and cheerfulness. In doing so, they will be exalted in the kingdom of Christ.

Jesus teaches that true greatness lies in being the servant of all. If someone desires to be first, they must be willing to take the lowest position and serve others. This principle of humility and selflessness is reiterated by Jesus on multiple occasions. The path to elevation in Christ's kingdom is found not in seeking personal glory or respect, but in willingly and joyfully performing the lowest tasks for the benefit of others. By embracing this mindset of service, one will find true greatness in the eyes of God.

Jesus teaches that true greatness is achieved by being the servant of all. He says, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all. This principle of humility and selflessness is emphasized by Jesus on several occasions. Instead of seeking personal glory or respect, one should willingly and cheerfully perform the lowliest tasks and serve others diligently. By adopting this mindset, one will find elevation in the kingdom of Christ, as true greatness is found in selfless service.

In Mark 9:35, Jesus teaches that true greatness is attained through a servant's heart. He says, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all. This principle of humility and selflessness is reiterated by Jesus on different occasions. Rather than seeking personal recognition or exaltation, one should willingly embrace the role of a servant, performing even the lowest tasks with diligence and cheerfulness. It is through this humble posture that one finds true greatness in the kingdom of Christ.

Jesus teaches that true greatness is achieved through selfless service to others. He says, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all. By willingly taking the lowest position and serving others with humility and cheerfulness, one can find true greatness in the eyes of God. This principle of humility and selflessness is emphasized by Jesus in various instances, highlighting the importance of putting others before ourselves and embracing the role of a servant.
